title: Women's behaviour, beliefs and information sources about physical exercise in pregnancy
abstract:
to examine the potential effect of low-risk pregnancy on women's recreational activity patterns and to explore pregnant women's beliefs and information sources regarding physical exercise participation.\ud
\ud
Design: preliminary, prospective survey\ud
\ud
Setting: participants’ homes in the East Midlands, UK.\ud
\ud
Participants: fifty-seven nulliparous, pregnant women
